article:
The 'M43 field cap' or "EinheitsmÃ¼tze" was a cap used by the German Wehrmacht
and SS, during World War II. The design of the fieldcap was based on the German
GebirgsjÃ¤ger's ski cap, the only differences being the bill was slightly
extended and the top panel of the hat had a smaller circumference, giving it
slightly sloped in sides. This design and its successors that are still in use
today are the German counterparts to the American patrol cap or utility cover.
 Image:Sswoolm43.jpg|An M43 wool Field cap with SS insignia, showing
folded and unfolded ear flaps. Image:Camom43s.jpg|3 Camouflaged M41 field caps
in Heer Splinter, Italian, and SS blurred edge. Note sweatband on fall side of
SS field cap.
